column2: As our Delivery Manager, you will have the opportunity to use your skills to ensure our projects are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest standard.      You will establish collaborative relationships with both our internal team and our clients, ensuring effective communication and satisfactory results.      This role is crucial in maintaining our commitment to our clients, delivering holistic, scalable solutions of the highest quality and on time.      If you are a dynamic individual with skills in project management, demonstrating a keen eye for detail, and are passionate about driving successful projects, we d love to hear from you. Please read the detailed job description below to learn more about what the role involves and the skills/experience we are looking for.          What You Will Do          Manage internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects.      Ensure that all projects are delivered on time, within scope, and budget.      Develop project scopes and objectives, involve all relevant stakeholders, and ensure technical feasibility.      Ensure resource availability and allocation.      Develop a detailed project plan to track progress.      Measure project performance using appropriate systems, tools, and techniques.      Report and escalate management issues to management as needed.      Manage the relationship with the client and all stakeholders.      Perform risk management to minimize project risks and maintain comprehensive project documentation.              What We Are Looking For          Proven working experience as a project administrator in the information technology sector.      Solid technical background with understanding and/or hands-on experience in software development and web and mobile technologies.      Excellent client-facing and internal communication skills.      Excellent written and verbal communication skills.      Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multitasking skills.      A bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.          Bonus Points          Masters in Business Administration or related field.      Project Management Professional (PMP) / PRINCE II certification.      Proficiency in project management software tools.      Experience working with teams across different time zones and cultures.          Your Mindset          You're adaptable and flexible to the changing demands of a fast-paced work environment.      You possess a growth mindset and are ready to learn new things and implement them.      You have a client-first mindset, ensuring customer satisfaction remains a top priority.      You're a team player who values collaboration and consensus among team members.      You're proactive, taking ownership of tasks and driving them towards completion.      You're focused on the big picture without losing sight of the small details.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and versatile professional to join our team as a Delivery Lead     This role, requiring strong leadership, delivery management skills, and expertise in agile methodologies     The ideal candidate will possess a solid understanding of delivery principles, excellent communication skills, and the ability to drive collaboration and productivity within cross-functional teams             Key Responsibilities:         Project Management:         Lead and manage the end-to-end delivery, including team planning, execution, monitoring, and closure.         Develop comprehensive delivery plans, including scope, timelines, resources, and budgets, and ensure adherence to project objectives and constraints.         Define and track delivery milestones, deliverables, and dependencies, proactively identifying and addressing any issues or risks.         Manage budgets, track expenditures, and ensure effective resource allocation and utilization.         Collaborate with stakeholders to establish delivery goals(scope, schedule, cost, and quality) objectives, and success criteria.         Serve as the Scrum Master for agile projects, Manage Scrum Board, facilitate the teams adoption of Scrum practices and ensuring adherence to the Scrum framework.         Guide and coach the development team on agile principles and practices, promoting self-organization and continuous improvement.         Ensure transparency and provide regular updates to stakeholders on project progress, risks, and dependencies.         Team Leadership:         Provide leadership and guidance to cross-functional teams, promoting a collaborative and high-performance culture.         Foster a positive and productive work environment, encouraging teamwork, open communication, and knowledge sharing.         Set clear expectations for team members, define roles and responsibilities, and support their professional growth and development.         Resolve conflicts or issues within the team, promoting effective problem-solving and decision-making.         Stakeholder Management:         Establish and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders, including clients, senior management, and other project teams or PODs.         Communicate effectively with stakeholders, providing regular project updates, managing expectations, and addressing any concerns or issues.         Identify and manage stakeholder requirements and expectations, ensuring alignment with delivery objectives and deliverables.         Continuous Improvement:         Drive continuous improvement initiatives within the team and organization, leveraging agile principles and best practices.         Conduct retrospectives to identify areas for improvement in the teams processes, communication, and collaboration.         Implement process enhancements and share lessons learned to optimize project delivery.         Qualifications and Skills:         Bachelors/Masters/Professional degree.         10-12 years of experience in IT industry. In that, at least 3 years as project delivery manager and 1 year as scrum master.         Experience in using agile tools like Jira / VersionOne / ServiceNow.         Proven experience as a delivery personnel leading complex projects in an agile environment.         Strong knowledge of delivery management methodologies, tools, and techniques.         Proficiency in agile methodologies, particularly Scrum, and experience in applying agile practices in project management.         Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.         Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, knowledge management skills with the ability to make informed decisions and manage risks.         PMP (Project Management Professional) and Scrum Master certifications (CSM) are desirable.         Familiarity with project management tools and software.           As a Delivery Lead, you will play a critical role in successfully delivering projects by combining strong delivery management skills with agile principles       Your ability to lead teams, drive collaboration, and ensure project success will be instrumental in achieving the organizations objectives

column2: The Release Train Engineer (RTE) has primary purpose of supporting and coaching an Agile Release Train (ART) by steering it to success and navigating the complexity of delivering software in large, cross-functional environments. The RTE helps resolve and escalate impediments, manages risk, helps assure value delivery, and drives program level continuous improvement. The RTE is accountable for the overall planning, coordination, execution, and delivery of value through the program.        RESPONSIBILITIES FOR RELEASE TRAIN ENGINEER:          Facilitate the coordinated preparation and execution of release planning for the ART. This includes:          Working with the ART team who prioritizes the features to be considered in the next program increment (PI) planning cycle.          Facilitating the ART team s refinement of features to be considered in the next PI planning cycle to meet the Feature Definition of Ready.          Assists the ART in communication and coordination with stakeholders and customers during feature definition and delivery.          Ensuring effective communication and coordination for and during quarterly planning.          Managing change to the ART s PI plan and the impacts of those changes.          Drive cross team, ART, and departmental impediments, planning, collaboration, and coordination.          Provide regular and open communication across the program and stakeholders for transparency and awareness of progress and impediments.          Understand, visualize and manage upstream/downstream dependencies.          Drive delivery and continuous improvement by utilizing feedback and metrics (quality, delivery rate, etc.) to identify areas of opportunity.          Work across stakeholders and teams to continuously improve.          Ensure the overall cost, schedule, and performance of the program.          Analyze program budgets and estimates from participating organizations to provide direction for the overall development of all program budgets and integrated cost profiles.          Manage program level coordination, such as creating timelines, milestones, and cadence of increments and releases and oversee the development of reports and analyses that document program activity.          Lead project teams and provide and leadership; act as consultant/coach to management in resolving unusually difficult problems.          Participate with management and cross-functional teams as subject matter expert to develop and improve operating policies and procedures related to Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe) and be an advocate in adopting Agile and SAFe best practices and processes.          Act as a galvanizing force for sharing Agile and SAFe knowledge across the organization.          Constantly refine and stay current with emerging themes in larger Agile community.          Develop / modify processes, policies, and procedures to facilitate the working relationship between Global Technology and its business functions / partners.          Support the configuration of SAFe to the needs of the organization, standardizing and documenting practices.          Coach leaders, teams, and Scrum Masters in Lean-Agile practices and mindsets.          JOB EXPERIENCE FOR RELEASE TRAIN ENGINEER:          8-10 years progressive work related experience with demonstrated proficiency in multiple disciplines / technologies / processes related to the position as well as 3-5 years managing teams and / or significant complex projects.          Proven, prior experience as Release Train Engineer for long lived value streams and Products.          SKILL REQUIREMENTS FOR RELEASE TRAIN ENGINEER:          Demonstrated Release Train Engineer experience in organizing, planning and executing large-scale projects from conception through implementation. Experience coordinating multiple teams in a technology environment.          Demonstrated effective verbal and written communication skills for the purpose of providing and explaining technical and project related information to clients, vendors, senior management and staff.          Ability to easily build new relationships and proactively establish a variety of contacts across the organization.          Ability to work in multi-disciplinary, multi-cultural teams.          Broad range of program management and leadership skills required.          Proven ability to balance concurrent activities.          Strong knowledge and experience in software development in an Agile environment.          Certifications:          Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification or equivalent REQUIRED.          Certified Scrum Professional (CSP) certification or equivalent - DESIRED.          SAFe Certified Release Train Engineer certification or equivalent - DESIRED.          Project Management Institute Agile Certified Professional or equivalent - DESIRED.

column2: Job Title: Offshore Development Center (ODC) Manager Job Overview: The Offshore Development Center (ODC) Manager will be responsible for overseeing and managing the operations of our offshore development center, ensuring seamless collaboration between onshore and offshore teams, maintaining high-quality deliverables, and achieving project goals within budget and timelines. The ODC Manager will play a crucial role in building and maintaining a strong partnership with the client's onshore team, managing resources, and driving the successful execution of software development projects. Key Responsibilities: 1. Team Management: - Lead, mentor, and manage the offshore development team, including software engineers, testers, and other technical professionals. - Provide technical guidance, support, and motivation to ensure optimal team performance and professional growth. - Foster a positive and collaborative team culture that encourages innovation and continuous improvement. 2. Project Planning and Execution: - Collaborate with the client's onshore team to understand project requirements, scope, and objectives. - Develop project plans, allocate resources, and create schedules to ensure timely and high-quality deliverables. - Monitor project progress, identify risks, and implement mitigation strategies to achieve project milestones. 3. Client Relationship Management: - Establish and maintain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including the client's project managers, technical leads, and business representatives. - Serve as the main point of contact for all communication related to project status, updates, and issue resolution. 4. Quality Assurance: - Implement and enforce software development best practices, coding standards, and quality assurance processes. - Conduct regular code reviews and ensure adherence to established guidelines to deliver reliable and secure software solutions. 5. Resource Management: - Optimize resource allocation, capacity planning, and workload distribution to meet project demands efficiently. - Identify skill gaps and training needs within the team and work to address them through training and skill development initiatives. 6. Performance Measurement and Reporting: - Track and report on project performance metrics, including progress, budget utilization, and resource utilization. - Prepare regular status reports and presentations for the client and senior management. Qualifications: - Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. - Proven experience (15+ years) in software development and technical project management.  - Hands on experience in  Java, Spring Boot, Microservices, hibernate, struts . Exposure to Front End  skills like React .JS/React Native is desired. - Experience managing offshore development teams and working in an ODC model. - Expectation is involve with code reviews, technical discussions etc  - Strong leadership, interpersonal, and communication skills. - Proficiency in project management tools and methodologies. - In-depth understanding of software development lifecycle and best practices. - Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.  - Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities.

column2: Delivery managers at Lab49 manage all aspects of delivering on an engagement with a client      The responsibility of the Senior Delivery Manager will be        to both manage the Lab49 consultants based in the region to deliver software solutions for our client, but also to hold the client accountable to providing the dependencies required by theLab49 consultant teams, to deliver the project        You will be fronting the Lab49 delivery management of a large program of work, with not only the local team of consultants but also multiple full feature delivery squads in the APAC & EMEA regions      You will provide on the ground delivery management services towards the larger programme and account, reporting into and supported by the Lab49 Programme & Account manager               Lab49 Delivery managers are responsible for:          Planning, tracking and risk management, within the context of Agile and Enterprise best practices. This includes financial management to fixed price delivery.      Dependency management: ensuring that client deliverables are met to support the Lab49 delivery to the client.      People management: project and team resourcing, promoting positive, collaborative and productive team dynamics, conflict resolution, and personnel development.      Client management: manage client communication, stakeholder expectations, and generally all aspects of the relationship as it pertains to the engagement to positive outcome.      Quality oversite: ensuring process and controls are in place to ensure quality from requirements through delivery. Delivery managers need to have sufficient business and technology domain to ensure that quality is being delivered.      Contractual management: understanding and managing to the terms of the contract.      The engagement may require that Delivery Manager be hands-on. This might include reviewing UX designs, testing software, writing requirements, editing technical documents.      Additionally, our Delivery Managers are consultants advising clients and supporting business development. This aspect of the role includes:      Delivery consulting: being at the forefront of best practises and advising our clients in the practical application of best practises and guiding them through process and organization transformation.      Strategic planning and roadmap development for major technology transformations.      Business development: develop client relationships, identify opportunities and help shape and deliver pitches.      Being an ambassador for the Lab49 brand.          Skills & Knowledge:          Strong Project Management skills: planning, tracking, risk identification and mitigation.      Energy to drive project progression across multiple delivery squads.      People management.      Stakeholder management.      Agile development methodologies.      Working knowledge of the commercial banking markets.      Working knowledge of typical financial flows and architecture.      Excellent communication skills: able to represent the team, project and firm in client situations, and similarly also be an advocate for the client.      Financial management experience (revenue, cost, duration) of portfolio management processes.      Excellent problem-solving skills and collaborative style of working.          Experience - Principal:          Minimum 5years of experience managing the implementation of financialservices systems, commercial banking experience preferred.      Minimum 5years of experience managing teams 5 - 12 people      Minimum 10 years of experience in IT Industry      Software development experience a plus          Education          Bachelor degree, ideally in Computing Science or related field      Finance education a plus

column2: Sagitec is seeking a Deputy Manager with an IT background and experience in large scale project management and contract execution of system implementations across the entire Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and proficient with industry standard project management practices. The deputy project manager is responsible for working with the Sagitec Project Management Office (PMO) and Project Manager to ensure project teams adopt Sagitec quality and compliance standards and policies and procedures, maintain and enhance client relationships, resolve challenges, and align to the direction set for the project.         The deputy manager is directly involved in project governance, with the Sagitec PMO and the client, to ensure successful delivery within the time, cost, and quality parameters of the project. The deputy project manager is expected to work with the Sagitec Project Manager to make strategic decisions for the project, drive project actions, communicate clearly, collaborate effectively, and align internal and client teams to achieve project goals with minimal supervision. Individuals who possess a strong, but diplomatic personality, and are strategic, analytical, detail oriented, problem solvers are best suited for this role.       Responsibilities:         Leverage industry standard best project management practices.         Maintain and manage overall project schedule from assignment through completion.         Develop and own project plans and project management artifacts.         Manage and coordinate cross-functional teams to meet project schedules, milestones, goals, and client expectations.         Prepare and report project status to both Sagitec and client stakeholders.         Assist in managing project scope and manage change control processes and terms of the contract.         Assist in managing financial health of the project (including billing and collections).         Promote quality throughout project activities based on Sagitec and industry standards for quality assurance.         Identify and communicate process improvements.         Anticipate and identify challenges and resolve them as they occur.         Approach challenges and conflicts positively.         Proactively manage decisions and risks associated to the project.         Lead team meetings with Sagitec project teams and client project teams.         Assist in managing project resources and resource planning.         Capable of setting direction for the project team in all aspects of solution delivery (SDLC).         Establish and monitor relationship with client stakeholders at all levels.         Promote collaboration and team dynamics across Sagitec and client teams.         Communicate and collaborate clearly and professionally in all methods of communication (i.e., verbal, written).         Assume additional project responsibilities to ensure project and Sagitec success.         Collaborate with other project managers within Sagitec on project management process improvements and methodologies.         Participate in business development activities as requested.         The role may include part time or full-time travel to client locations.         Minimum Qualifications:           Minimum 3 years of professional experience working as a Deputy Project Manager/Project Manager on large-scale projects.               Experience in all aspects of solution implementation project management from plan development and execution, project activity monitoring, project messaging and communication, and driving tasks to completion.           Knowledge in the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).               Experience with managing resources on cross functional teams.           Experience with project planning, risk management, and issue resolution.               Experience in financial management of large-scale projects.           Experience with Microsoft Office and Microsoft Project or other recognized scheduling software tool. A collaborative mindset with the ability to work in team environment, but also self-motivated to produce results with minimal direction.           Ability to form working relationships with groups of people from varied backgrounds, experience, and education levels.           Preferred Qualifications:           Experience with Public Sector solution implementations.               Experience with IV&V vendor oversight on solution implementations.           Experience in pension administration or benefit claim systems.               On track for PMI-PMP certification or completion of a certified project management course.         Education:           Bachelor s degree, preferably in Computer Science, IT, Management, Math, Business, or related field.              Master s degree a plus.

column2: Microsoft ToDo, Planner and Project Online are part of the Microsoft 365 offerings for Modern Workplace. The team is providing these Services and other Microsoft 365 Services globally to ~70.000 users. Task Management in Microsoft 365 will become more and more popular on our way to a digital company.     As Product Owner (m / f / diverse) of Microsoft Task Management which includes the Services Microsoft ToDo, Planner and Project Online, you are responsible for translating the requirements in this area into system requirements.       Task and Responsibilities                 End-to-end ownership for IT services around M365 Task Management, close cooperation with the business and other internal IT service teams and architects, ensuring the operation of IT services.         Consulting and support for the implementation of new projects and solutions, changes to existing services, analysis of new business requirements to increase productivity in the business units.         As part of new developments, you are responsible for the product / service backlog within a Scrum team. During the implementation, you will work closely with business stakeholders (eg business owners, key users) and with external partners.         You coordinate the operation of the IT services used by SHS IT internally, ie you analyze, monitor and coordinate service changes.         You will work with the stakeholders to set up business solutions and ensure that these solutions fit into the business strategy and meet the expected goals.         You will drive the further harmonization of IT services for internal communication and assess the migration of existing solutions into the Siemens Healthineers IT service landscape.         In addition, you are responsible for compliance with the Q, ISEQ and DP regulations.       Required Education, Experience and Knowledge/Skills             You are exactly the right person for this position if you are interested in healthcare and want to support internal IT in introducing integrated solutions for the area of collaboration.         You have a degree in computer science or business administration or have acquired a comparable qualification.         You have professional experience in IT and in managing international projects and / or international applications.         You have a project management background/ knowledge and can consult the business in Task management and in setting up projects in Project Online.         You must be proficient (at least 3 years of experience) around Microsoft ToDo, Planner and Project Online and other Microsoft services like SharePoint Online or Dataverse and must be able to demonstrate sound functional understanding of the above Services.         You have in-depth knowledge in user adoption including training, change management and coaching or consulting.         With your analytical and methodical skills, you manage the product backlog with global requirements and consider dependencies.         As an excellent team player with a strong focus on the (internal) customer you communicate and work effectively in a multi-cultural environment

column2: The Electric Mobility program at WRI India aims to accelerate transport electrification in India, to reduce urban air pollution and support the decarbonization of the sector. We work with national and state level governments, industry stakeholders and technical bodies across a range of projects spanning from research to policy formulation and on-ground implementation. With the growing impetus from the Government of India on the transition to electric vehicles, the E-Mobility team at WRI India offers an exciting and challenging work experience in which dynamic individuals will thrive and grow.    This position is for a Manager with the E-Mobility program. The role offers a mix of project management, research development and stakeholder engagement, and we are looking for an experienced professional to help lead our initiatives.                  ?       How your day will unfold:               ?         Project Management (40%):               Lead day-to-day management of assigned projects to ensure timely completion of project deliverables and ensure quality of work for all final deliverables   Liaise closely with the reporting manager to shape assigned projects   Manage project timelines and budgets, and guide the project team for successful project delivery   Contribute to various aspects of project delivery as needed, such as government interfacing, partner management, people engagement, project documentation etc.   Identify new opportunities and synergies with other ongoing initiatives and projects, and support colleagues across the e-mobility team as needed   Liaise with other WRI offices and partner institutions for data exchange, information requests and project coordination            Stakeholder engagement (40%):                    Lead focused engagements with different government departments, state nodal agencies for EV policy implementation, automobile cluster associations, private enterprises/ start-ups, experts, citizen groups, academia etc, as needed.    Build and nurture relationships with different stakeholders by constantly communicating with them about the ongoing/ potential engagements.   Coordinate and engage specifically with social enterprises, entrepreneurs, investors that may interact and be part of an integrated system that incorporates new technologies in the electric mobility space.    Present insights/ findings on behalf of WRI India at relevant multi-stakeholder forums   Liaise with academic experts, industry professionals and other external stakeholders to gather primary data, seek collaborations and undertake joint projects    Work with team members to organize events, workshops, webinars etc. and develop presentations/discussion materials, to present WRI India s work externally            Research (20%):               Undertake primary and/or secondary research to develop analyses and recommendations for the e-mobility ecosystem   Conduct and support data collection, data analysis and present analysis to relevant internal and external stakeholders   Lead secondary research to complement the interviews and consultations to identify and map the existing needs, gaps, and impact on the electric mobility ecosystem   Write knowledge products (e.g., reports, briefs, data-products) - independently and as part of a larger team working on specific deliverables   Develop and articulate clear project concepts and robust project content, backed by research and data   Keep abreast of industry trends, policy landscape and sectoral developments          Qualifications and requirements we seek:         Master s degree in public policy, sustainable transportation, renewable energy, or other related disciplines, with a focus on research-oriented disciplines and an excellent academic track record   7-10 years of work experience, with expertise in research and policy analysis   Knowledge and experience in sustainable transport and electric mobility are a must   Impeccable writing and verbal skills in English to coherently convey complex information to a technical and policy audience   Should have experience in writing reports, briefs and academic papers   Familiarity with sustainable urbanization and transportation, and electric mobility is necessary.    Willingness to learn and gain expertise in unfamiliar subjects is necessary   Ability to lead and undertake initiatives with minimal supervision   Experience in managing small teams will be preferred
column11: Stakeholder Engagement, Data analysis, Renewable energy, Nutrition, Project management, Data collection, Research, Project delivery, Secondary research, Electricals

column2: We are looking for a Technical Programme Manager who will play a crucial role in overseeing and managing complex technical projects within our organisation. Therefore, we believe the following qualities are important for someone in this position:       Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to think critically and make informed decisions.     Attention to Detail: Strong attention to detail and a commitment to delivering high-quality results.     Self-Motivation: Ability to work independently with minimal supervision and take initiative.     Time Management: Strong organisational skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritise tasks effectively and meet deadlines.     Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Ability to think critically and make informed decisions.     Communication Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders and convey complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders.     Adaptability: Adaptive and accustomed to a fast-paced and dynamic working environment       What a Technical Programme Manager means to us      A Technical Programme Manager s responsibility is that of a facilitator, to ensure the successful execution of projects, from initiation to completion, by coordinating and collaborating with cross-functional teams. This involves translating strategic business objectives into actionable plans, ensuring cross-functional collaboration, and driving the successful delivery of projects that support the companys goals.         How you can help us      There are certain functions and capabilities we believe are essential to the role:         Program Planning and Execution   : Develop and execute comprehensive project plans, considering timelines, and resource allocation.       Project Coordination   : Acts as the central point of contact for complex projects, ensuring that all components are aligned and that communication flows smoothly among various teams and stakeholders via the established processes and practices we have at Atlas.       Cross-functional collaboration   : Collaborate with engineering, product management, design, QA, operations, and other relevant teams to define project requirements, scope, and deliverables. Ensure smooth communication and cooperation among all stakeholders. To identify, assign ownership and clear any blockers for stakeholders.       Stakeholder Communication   : Establish clear communication channels with stakeholders at all levels through verbal, written and presentational forms. Provide regular status updates, resolve issues, and ensure transparency throughout the project lifecycle.       Risk Management   : Identify, analyze, and mitigate project risks. Develop contingency plans to address potential obstacles and ensure project success.     Resource Management: Coordinate and manage project resources. Monitor and report on resource usage to ensure optimal efficiency.       Quality Assurance   : Ensure that deliverables meet quality standards and project requirements. Coordinate testing and validation processes as needed.       Continuous Improvement   : Identify opportunities for process improvement within program management practices. Implement best practices and drive operational excellence.       Documentation and Reporting   : Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, status reports, and meeting minutes. Prepare and present project updates to senior management and other stakeholders as required.           What we consider relevant qualifications, experience and knowledge      Skills and capabilities we believe are highly relevant include:       3 to 5 years of experience in technical program management, project management, or a related field. Experience in software development or technology-related projects is highly desirable     Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams and drive projects to successful completion     Proficient in English both written and spoken     Passionate about joining an early start venture, with an appreciation of the differences between highly established and early-stage businesses     Familiarity with agile methodologies is a plus     Experience in JIRA software is a plus           Performance indicators to get you off to a great start      A touch down quick win (30 Days):       Getting to know the various departments and their roles and responsibilities     Understanding the project processes     Understanding and familiarising yourself with the Hugosave app     Understanding the systems and platforms being used by the various departments     ?

column2: Salesforce Platforms Automotive Find endless opportunities to solve our clients' toughest challenges, as you work with exceptional people, the latest tech and leading companies across industries. Practice:  Automotive, Industry Consulting, Global Network  I Areas of Work: Salesforce (SFDC) Platform |  Level:Manager  |  Location: Bangalore, Gurugram, Mumbai, Chennai, Pune |  Years of Exp: 8-14 years |  Language :English Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture Are you an outcome-oriented problem solver? Do you enjoy working on transformation strategies for global clients? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, Accenture Strategy and Consulting is the right place for you to explore limitless possibilities. The Practice A Brief Sketch GN Automotive Practice has deep expertise in delivering Digital Transformations, Sales & Operations Planning, Salesforce Consulting, SAP Transformation, Spare Parts & Warranty Management, Service Process Excellence, Connected Vehicles, Dealer performance Management, Process Automation & Digitization, Software Enablement, Zero Based Spend & Spend analysis, Peer Benchmarking, Value Architecture, Process Improvement, IoT and Industry Analytics Let's infuse fresh thinking in the systems and turn new ideas into reality. As a part of the team, you'll help drive the following: Deliver consulting projects  using Techno-Functional Consulting background in Salesforce CRM in automotive context (Automotive Cloud/ sales cloud/service cloud/marketing cloud Be a part of the Intelligent Functions team , one of the key capabilities or sub-industry areas to support Platforms-driven business design and assessment such as value assessment, business case creation, business process re-engineering and so on. Provide solutions for complex client problems  across the Salesforce landscape throughout the project lifecycle, providing subject matter expertise with a strong strategic awareness of the SFDC market and associated technologies. Work as a lead Salesforce Functional Solution Architect  and support with solutions for end-to-end request for proposal requests. Engage with clients in understanding their requirements, scoping, discovering and defining solutions , explaining business benefits and use cases and developing a roadmap to meet their goals. Create innovative solution designs  that utilize our extensive service offerings. column2: This position would require a highly motivated candidate that can work on deploying solar energy projects, as well as other futuristic projects in areas across India including high risk institutions (such as institutions for people with disabilities), public health and education facilities, livelihood centres and other last mile communities. The broader goal is to use futuristic solutions that can leapfrog improved well-being, livelihoods and healthcare.     The ideal candidate should have strong skills in coordinating operations and communications (written and verbal). He/she must be able to lead projects and work in teams, while being able to collaborate with partners and key stakeholders (including internal project teams, on-ground partners, and external entities such as CSR partners). The role requires individuals who are skilled in coordination, estimation and budget management and project execution. The projects require an approach which challenges the set paradigms and come up with end to end solutions- employing resourcefulness in project design, implementation and monitoring project problems. We seek individuals who are able to work very hands-on on the site while also being able to extract key learnings for the sector as a whole. The candidate must be a motivated self-starter that is comfortable and willing to work in an unstructured environment. They should be able to generate their own work and have exhibited experience of the same in previous engagements.   The Futuristic and HRI Programs team aims to have creative, out of the box thinkers who are curious and are natural problem solvers.       ?       Roles and Responsibilities:       ?     Operations and project management:        Coordinate with key teams and stakeholders (internal and external) to ensure smooth operations of special projects- from lead generation and site assessment, to procurement and implementation         Plan project execution by engaging with field partners/ internal field teams, procurement teams, local energy enterprises in different geographies         Manage key partnerships for futuristic and special projects of decentralised solar energy solutions implementation and deployment as well as other futuristic solutions to be deployed as per site         Travel periodically to ensure smooth implementation of projects         Manage logistics and vendor coordination       Identification and mapping:        Liaising with programme teams (on need)         Mapping potential futuristic opportunities at sites         Mapping potential partners       Tracking budgets and implementation:        Responsible for overall planning, implementation and tracking of all special and futuristic projects         Track and share reports on budgets, project execution progress on a biweekly and monthly basis         Track reporting timelines for various special and futuristic projects       Sharing learnings:        Strategically track special solar project and futuristic projects across regions and focus areas (innovation, wellbeing, education, livelihoods, healthcare)         Collate learnings from the work being done and generate monthly, quarterly and funder reports         Coordinate with senior managers and team members to share progress         Ensure projects are monitored and evaluated         Coordinate with outreach team members for proper archiving and dissemination of information         Key requirements         Bachelors or Masters in Development/ Finance and Management/ Renewable energy or related subject areas.         6 or more years of work experience, preferably in partnerships, program design and implementation. Experience with managing CSR projects is advantageous         Highly motivated, responsible, self-directed, resourceful and flexible; Ability to multi- task         Willingness to work with other team members; strong engagement, leadership, operational and coordination skills         Interest in solar energy projects implementation and deployment aimed at improving energy reliability and quality in areas that are not connected or unreliably connected to the grid         Good Communication skills- on qualitative and quantitative aspects; Ability to work on budgets         Ability to bring information together in an easily readable form for a wide range of audiences.         Willingness to travel to rural locations for 5-10 days on a monthly basis.         Strong working knowledge of English; Additionally, spoken knowledge of at least one regional language would be desirable (particularly Kannada/ Hindi/ Tamil/ Odiya)

column2: Rentomojo is seeking a highly skilled and experienced Technical Program Manager to join our dynamic team      As a Technical Program Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the planning, execution, and delivery of complex technical projects within the organization      You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including engineering, product management, and operations, to ensure successful project outcomes            The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent project management skills, and a passion for driving innovation and efficiency. column2: Coordinate with related Product Managers and stakeholders to drive milestone setting and decision-making. This involves not only India members but also members from various oversea countries.      Promote the program and accurately share with the relevant stakeholders any progress and risks involved in an entire program      Work with the cross-functional teams to manage prioritisation, execution and monitoring of project activities      Influence business, operational and technical teams to ensure that best practices are followed and implemented.      Champion the key pillars of Program Change Management: Stakeholder management, Communications, Training, Metrics, Resistance management and Recognition practices.      Identify gaps in the technology and work with the teams to drive improvements.      Bold Challenges      The Mercari marketplace app has been downloaded by millions of users mainly in Japan and the US, and each individual user utilizes the service in their own particular way. We still have a ways to go to achieve our mission of Create value in a global marketplace where anyone can buy sell. This is why we are constantly challenging ourselves with the latest innovations, which allows us to grow as a company.      In order to implement large projects (programs), initiatives, and more amid these challenges, we involve various divisions and multiple development teams in implementation. Creating and implementing the plans that will make these things happen are the job of our Program Managers. As Mercari s organisations grow, they are becoming more diverse. Leading a program in such an organisation means coming up with and implementing big ideas and plans.      If you re ready to conjure bold ideas and plans while working with the highly skilled engineers who join Mercari all the time, then come and help us change the definition of value the world over.              Those who agree with the mission and values of the Mercari Group and each company      Enthusiasm for strengthening the engineering organization      5 years or more experience as a project manager or engineer leader      Experience in detecting and resolving product and organizational issues on your own      Experience in designing and actually implementing systems and rules for teams and organizations (rules for small teams are also acceptable)      In-depth understanding of Agile methodologies, particularly Scrum and Kanban.      Experience/Understanding of technical concepts relevant to cloud, front-end and back-end development methodologies, APIs, and software engineering.      Excellent project management skills, with a proven track record of successfully managing complex technical projects from initiation to completion. column2: Skill required:  Sourcing & Procurement - Procurement Strategy and Planning Designation:  Service Delivery Ops Lead Senior Manager Qualifications: Any Graduation  Years of Experience: 16 to 25 years  What would you do? Go beyond processing purchase orders at lower costs to help clients reap savings and value from the billions they spend on the goods and services that run their day-to-day business operations. You will be working as a part of Procurement management team which uses a systematic approach for buying all the goods and services needed for a company to stay sustainable. They are involved in the identification of need, finding and qualifying the suppliers, requesting proposals, negotiating with suppliers, contracting, delivery and analyzing results.The Procurement Strategy and Planning team is responsible for establishing long-range plans for ensuring a timely supply of goods and/or services that are critical to our firm's ability to meet its core business objectives. The team is focused on ensuring on-time delivery of materials at the designated place from suppliers while managing any queries during the process. Coordinating with suppliers & other stakeholders, determining expediting methodology, keeping track of delivery schedules, inspections, PO amendments, project milestones, & post-PO management will all be critical elements. The role may require you to have experience working in Direct or Indirect (CAPEX, MRO) categories, knowledge of PO Processing, Vendor Master Data, Tactical Buying / Spot Buys, RFx, Procurement Help Desk functions, Process Optimization, QA Framework, etc. What are we looking for? column2: The Program Manager is responsible for the development and execution of a portfolio of projects and programs for the organization. Develop and control deadlines, budgets, and activities.         Apply change, risk, and resource management.         Resolve projects higher scope issues. column2: As the QC Technical Manager, your primary responsibility will be to manage the Automation Team, QC Data Analytics Team, and Research Development Team. You will lead the way in utilizing global technology advancements to elevate our games quality.     This role requires delivering effective solutions, such as tools and automation, to empower our QC workforce to embrace a more creative approach to testing and reduce repetitive tasks. Additionally, you will take charge of managing the Data Analytics team. Your work will be instrumental in driving discussions surrounding QC productivity, efficiency, and Game Quality through the creation of informative dashboards and reports, collaboratively developed with your teams assistance.     Note: Final Designation/Level will be decided based on the relevant experience and interview ratings           Main responsibilities:              AUTOMATION AND RD           Lead a team comprising of a Technical Director, Product Owner, and RD Manager, as well as Automation Project Managers, to conceptualize and develop end-to-end solutions tailored to the specific QC and Production requirements of our games         Connect with QC Project Managers and Program Managers to define how the Automation team can assist their projects. Use these insights to define your teams goals and priorities and accordingly manage their mandate         Efficiently manage the mandates and resource allocation for our teams, adhering to established timelines         Post delivery of solutions and tools work with Project Managers and Program Managers to improve adoption and put in place a feedback mechanism for the deliveries         Foster collaboration and knowledge-sharing with global teams working on similar topics, ensuring a cohesive contribution to Ubisoft s global ecosystem while avoiding duplicative efforts         Establish a data-driven culture within the automation team, closely monitoring and controlling the teams business KPIs to drive continuous improvement and optimal performance of our solutions         Cultivate a positive, open, and transparent collaborative environment between the Automation teams and Production teams globally         Remain informed about the latest global tech advancements to identify relevant areas for the RD team to explore         Cultivate strong relationships with La Forge and other RD teams globally, ensuring effective communication and knowledge exchange         Provide timely updates on your team s progress to key stakeholders locally and globally           DATA ANALYTICS           Lead a team of skilled Data Analysts and specialists, driving the development of a Data-Driven culture within our organization.         Collaborate closely with internal Project Managers and other key stakeholders to understand data requirements and propose effective solutions in the form of informative dashboards and reports.         Engage with Project Managers and QC Leadership to raise awareness about the benefits of Data-Oriented Testing Methodology, championing relevant initiatives in this direction.         Provide essential support to local and WWQC Operations by delivering data-driven solutions that define and enhance QC efficiency and productivity across the board.         Contribute to the creation of dashboards and reports that improve the overall governance and monitoring of our core deliverables.           GENERAL           Proactively monitor department resources and recommend appropriate team ramp-ups or ramp-downs as needed to optimize efficiency and productivity.         Skillfully plan, organize, and conduct regular assessments of team performance, implementing necessary improvements to achieve set goals.         Collaborate with HR teams to design comprehensive and well-defined career paths for various roles within your team, fostering professional growth and development.         Take charge of creating and overseeing the overall development plan for your teams, working closely with the Learning Development (LD) department to ensure access to relevant and suitable courses for continuous skill enhancement.       Strong Leadership Skills with a Proven Track Record of Managing Cross-Functional Teams     Proficiency in using Tech Advancements for Automation and R&D Purposes     Exceptional Collaboration and Communication Skills for Global

column2: The role of the Integration and technical Infrastructure Manager (ITIM) requires strong interpersonal, communication and organizational skills.          We are seeking a Project Manager with the ability to self-direct and who has a strong background in Fit-Out/Construction management, with an emphasis on delivering Telecom/Critical environments/Data center projects.          The ITIM is responsible for project management of all system integration and fit-out activities associated with MSFT-owned systems and/or services and their critical infrastructure required to be installed into a new data center facility.          The role requires the identification and management of scopes and interdependencies between all external and internal stakeholders and coordinating same with the physical construction with our GCs and other vendors.          The ITIM is responsible for coordinating the handover process and ensuring the required handover documentation and expectations are met to handover the space to our Operations teams and the business.          The ITIM is responsible for producing and managing project plans and executing major project milestones and for the financial approval and management function of these tasks on Microsoft own build and lease projects.          This position will be based onsite (multiple site locations available).         In alignment with our Microsoft values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day.               Required Qualifications               PMI (Project Management Institute) PMP (Project Management Professional) certification highly desired          Self-starter with demonstrated ability to manage multiple priorities, projects, and deadlines simultaneously          Experience managing large scale enterprise projects with both localized and virtual teams.         Cross-group collaborator and influencer across teams and organizations with proven success in participating in cross-functional teams to deliver on key projects.          Must be able to work within a dynamic team of full-time employees and consultants           High personal standard to deliver a thoughtful, polished and quality work product.                     Education               bachelors degree in computer science, business management, engineering, construction management or similar.           5+     years experience in IT fit out or construction related project management.                     Preferred Qualifications               BICSI RCDD or similar Telecommunications Design/Installation Experience is a plus         Previous Data Center construction/IT Fit out or management experience a plus.         Construction Health Safety Knowledge               The key responsibilities of the ITIM includes, but is not limited to:                     The ITIM will be a relentless advocate for managing a safe      worksite ,     supporting the implementation of the Microsoft High Risk Activity (HRA) program and work with our Construction PM and landlord groups to deliver trade collaboration methods to improve safe working and co-ordination of the job sites.                 The ITIM      is responsible for     coordinating internal Microsoft scope and resource efforts, requirements, and schedules with those of the GC, Owned Vendors and Suppliers to ensure a smooth and      timely     handover of the      fitted out     Data Centre facility and      capacity     to the Microsoft Operations team and Business Groups.                  The ITIM will coordinate with the Data Center Engineering (DCE) team and      supporting     specialty consultants to review, improve and execute the design.                  The ITIM      is responsible for     the coordination of the telecom materials procurement, telecoms installation, Security systems installation, FFE procurement and installation                 Coordination of the design, procurement, installation and turn up of the facility Corporate Network                  In cooperation with the Construction Lead this position aligns metro wide delivery strategies to local team      objectives     , business processes, vendor management strategies, and cross-group collaboration efforts.                  The ITIM will align with the Construction PM to agree delivery strategies across      multi     sites and manage a continuous improvement program that will result in a lean project delivery approach.                  The ITIM will be the responsible identifying and managing stakeholder dependencies and construction deliverables and handoffs for/with Microsoft Security (DCPS), Microsoft IT (CSE), DCI NE,      Networking     and Integrated services.                 The ITIM will work alongside the DCD Construction manager and report into the Regional ITIM team leader and      is responsible for     the delivery of Integration and Technical Infrastructure scope and deliverables for the US-West Region.                     Business Processes:                     Create and/or      maintain     best practices to      identify     and incorporate cost-effective solutions in line with evolving build and lease program specification requirements and report on KPIs for the same.                 Manage the selection, contracting, and integration of multiple vendors and internal partners.                  Drive deployment of solutions that can be socialized globally across DCD projects, both builds and leases.                 Facilitate client/sponsor decision-making to drive solutions, schedules, and manage change as      required     .                 Apply influence,      strategies     and negotiation skills to      identify     options and recommend solutions.                     Communication:                     Regularly reviews cost and KPI metrics, invoices, process/policy communications to client partners.                 Coordinate meetings and activities of vendors, cost managers, and integration of lessons learned in support of the Construction PM.                 Attend     scheduled Integration meeting and other project meetings, and      report     as necessary.                  Report Project Progress on scope, schedule, and budget in relation to the Integration scope and packages as      required     .                  Provide weekly project status reporting to Data Center Execution standards.                 Challenge and remove barriers by working with others around a shared need or customer benefit.                 Ability to      maintain     a broader perspective,      identify     and evaluate opportunities to enhance the business through cross-group collaboration.                 Incorporate diverse perspectives to thoroughly address complex business issues.                      Accountability:                     Responsible for developing, managing, and reporting on scope, schedule, and budget in relation to the Integration and technical fit-out scope and packages.                 Work independently in support of the Data Center Development Project.                 Track lessons learned and      identify     and execute on cost down site up opportunities.                 Provide Vendor oversight and performance management, as      required     .                 Support Preparation of Request for Proposal (RFP s), PER s, and other project approval tools templates.                 Review and approval of vendor scope of work and design review of site and building plans, as      required     .                 Validate vendor pay-application and invoice review and approval in line with milestone payment schedules.                 Manage compliance with prior audit results and recommendations.

Influence team for seamless product launches and business unit growth.     OI product launches on time and on spec.     Performance of launched OI products on revenue and profitability.               KEY COMPETENCIES             Motivated and Driven:    Demonstrate a strong desire to succeed and the determination to overcome challenges. Team Player:    Collaborate effectively with colleagues across departments, leveraging collective expertise and resources to deliver exceptional results. Experience in overseeing the execution of multiple projects within a program portfolio, from initiation to delivery, is highly desirable.       Leadership Skills:    Demonstrated ability to provide direction and to the cross-functional teams, driving alignment with organizational goals and objectives. The candidate should have the ability to influence and negotiate to ensure project success and foster collaborative relationships. YOUR EDUCATION AND BACKGROUND EXPERIENCE WILL INCLUDE:         Bachelor s degree in Engineering and MBA: The ideal candidate will possess a Bachelors degree in Engineering coupled with an MBA from an institution. This educational background equips the candidate with a solid foundation in both technical and business disciplines, essential for effective program management and decision-making in product development initiatives.     12-14 years of experience in Program Management: Candidates should have an experience in program management roles, particularly in the context of new product development (NPD) and open innovation initiatives. Experience in managing cross-functional teams and navigating project environments is essential.

column2: As a Delivery Manager, your role is to lead and manage technology projects from initiation to completion, ensuring successful delivery of software solutions     You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, business analysts, and stakeholders, to plan, execute, and deliver projects within scope, budget, and schedule     Your primary goal is to ensure the efficient and effective implementation of technology projects while managing risks, resolving issues, and ensuring stakeholder satisfaction             Responsibilities:         Project Planning: Collaborate with stakeholders to define project objectives, scope, and deliverables. Develop detailed project plans, including timelines, resource allocation, and dependencies. Identify and manage project risks and develop mitigation strategies.     Team Management: Lead and motivate cross-functional teams, including developers, designers, and business analysts. Assign tasks, provide guidance, and ensure collaboration and effective communication among team members. Monitor team performance and address any performance issues or conflicts.     Stakeholder Communication: Facilitate communication with project stakeholders, including clients, executives, and team members. Provide regular project updates, manage expectations, and address any concerns or issues. Ensure stakeholders are informed of project progress, risks, and changes.     Budget and Resource Management: Manage project budgets, track project expenses, and ensure efficient resource allocation. Work closely with finance and procurement teams to ensure project costs are controlled and aligned with approved budgets. Identify resource needs and negotiate resource allocation with stakeholders.     Project Execution: Oversee the execution of project activities, ensuring adherence to project plans and timelines. Monitor project progress, identify deviations, and take corrective actions as necessary. Coordinate and facilitate project meetings, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, and retrospectives.     Quality Assurance: Develop and implement quality assurance processes to ensure the delivery of high-quality software solutions. Establish quality standards, conduct regular project reviews, and manage the testing and validation processes. Ensure compliance with industry best practices and quality guidelines.     Risk and Issue Management: Identify, assess, and manage project risks and issues. Develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans. Proactively address issues, resolve conflicts, and escalate concerns when necessary.     Change Management: Manage changes to project scope, requirements, and timelines. Assess the impact of change requests and work with stakeholders to evaluate alternatives and make informed decisions. Communicate changes effectively to the project team and stakeholders.     Project Documentation: Create and maintain project documentation, including project charters, requirements documents, project plans, and status reports. Ensure documentation is accurate, up-to-date, and accessible to stakeholders.         Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in a related field (Masters degree preferred).     Proven experience as a Delivery Manager or in a similar project management role.     PMP, PRINCE2, or other relevant project management certifications are a plus.     Strong knowledge of project management methodologies and tools.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Leadership and team management experience.     Problem-solving and decision-making abilities.     Strong analytical and organizational skills.     Proficiency in project management software and tools.

column2: Managing Delivery Teams:  this involves assigning tasks and delivery rhythms, participating in staff selection and recruitment, training new members and supervising the whole team. Managing the budget:  the Delivery Managers tasks include monitoring and managing the departments operational budget. This may also require the compilation of weekly or monthly reports for the general manager. Distribution planning:  Delivery Managers are in charge of creating distribution plans that are as efficient as possible in terms of cost and time, in order to guarantee delivery to customers (using special software and programmes to do so) Order and inventory management:  orders are also under the supervision of the Delivery Manager. He/she has to make sure that the orders are completed and dispatched on time, as well as managing the warehouse inventory to ensure that there are sufficient resources and no risk of out-of-stock products. Meeting deadlines : as all distribution and order management is under the supervision of the Delivery Manager, ensuring that the team meets deadlines also falls under his or her job description. Negotiating contracts:  in addition to dealing with new contracts and their negotiation, Delivery Managers are also in charge of reviewing and renegotiating existing contracts. Handling customer problems:  Being in contact with and responsible for the entire supply chain, customer problems must also be taken care of by the Delivery Manager in order to manage their resolution. Communication skills:  the Delivery Manager has to deal with all players in the supply chain, from suppliers to consumers. For this reason, he/she must have developed excellent communication skills that enable him/her to perform all management, negotiation and problem-solving tasks to the best of his/her ability. Organisational skills:  the Delivery Manager must be able to manage and coordinate many different resources and work groups, assigning deliveries and deadlines that can be compatible with the workflow and delivery needs. Team leader:  It is essential that the Delivery Manager acts as a glue both within the individual teams and between the different work groups managed by him/her. This will ensure a smooth workflow with as few interruptions as possible. Change management:  Being able to handle problems and changes is a fundamental skill required of all Delivery Managers, so that any delays and interruptions in processing can be minimised. Done certification in past like PMP, Prince2, AgilePM etc.
column11: Project management, Delivery Management, IT Delivery Management, Delivery Manager

column2: The purpose behind the role of Acquisition Programs Manager is to acquire new security researchers (SRs) to consistently find valid vulnerabilities in the projects hosted on Immunefi s web3 bug bounty platform.        On a high level, the objectives of this role are:        Independently brainstorm new initiatives and activation plans to acquire SRs.      Competently execute those initiatives, and also initiatives handed down from team manager.      Develop an excellent Immunefi onboarding experience for SRs.      Create compelling content about Immunefi to be used as part of acquisition/promotional efforts.      Continually network and develop relationships with SRs.            To succeed in this role:            Most importantly, you must have user acquisition skills that take into account a long user acquisition/conversion cycle.      You must have your finger on the pulse of the web2 and web3 security communities.      You must know where SRs cluster, what types of SRs we are looking for, what SRs want and how we can provide it for them, and how to bring them on our platform, so they can submit high-quality bug reports to projects.      This requires creativity, flexibility, as well as ability to execute quickly, measure results, and pivot if necessary.      You must be able to engage SRs and communicate with fluency and clarity, while keeping in mind the underlying ethos and broad objectives of Immunefi that fit into the ecosystem of web3 which includes security, safety, and peace of mind for users and projects alike.                Responsibilities            Talent Acquisition Strategy:          Develop and implement a strategic plan for acquiring high-caliber SRs with a focus on software vulnerabilities.      Independently design, execute, and measure the initiatives for SR acquisition.      Double down on models that prove out and systematize them to scale.      Stay abreast of web2 and web3 security industry trends and emerging technologies to identify potential candidates.          Sourcing and Networking:          Proactively identify, engage, and build relationships with web2 and web3 SRs through various channels, including industry events, conferences, and online platforms. Be engaged wherever there are SRs.      Collaborate with internal and external networks to source top talent in the field.      Coordinate execution with our marketing team to maximize the reach of sourcing channels and strategy.          Candidate/Cluster Assessment:          Conduct in-depth evaluations of SR clusters and candidates to assess their technical skills, research capabilities, and track record in finding software vulnerabilities.          Integration Planning:          Develop onboarding and integration plans to seamlessly assimilate new SRs onto Immunefi, whether via educational components or otherwise.          Collaboration with Team:          Align acquisition strategies with the organizations overall security objectives.      Provide regular updates on acquisition progress and identify opportunities for improvement.                Skills and Traits            Adjustable: can work across timezones.      Project management: strong background in project management is essential. This includes the ability to plan, execute, and close projects efficiently, while also managing resources, budgets, and timelines effectively.      Independence + execution: is senior enough to take program proposals or initiatives in paper format and independently execute them into fully fleshed, operational programs and initiatives.      Responsible: for your own deadlines, work/life boundaries, and well-being.      Initiative: proactively finds problems and creates initiatives to solve them, talks to team members, and builds relationships with them.      Web3 native: has used dApps and crypto-wallets/exchanges, stays plugged into crypto news, understands the context of how things work in web3 such as borrowing, staking, and flash loans.      Personable and sociable: able to make friends with a variety of SR personalities, some of which will be very unique.      Bonus: Solidity/web3 security knowledge is not expected, but would be a huge bonus!                Requirements            Native English level. If your English is not at a native level, your application will not be considered.      Experience working with/for DAOs is a plus.      Experience in the cybersecurity industry, ideally working with hackers/SRs.      Experience as an Acquisition Program Manager or in a similar role.      Passion for Blockchain/Crypto/Web3/DeFi and a desire to work in this new and innovative space.      Enough technical experience or knowledge to be able to run in-person or online CTF events.

column2: WRI India?s Food, Land and Water program aims to inform India?s transition towards sustainable and resilient food and land use systems focusing on developing interdisciplinary nature-based solutions like landscape restoration, sustainable agriculture to mitigate climate impacts, enhance jobs and livelihoods and improve nutritional security     To catalyze systems change with a focus on circular food systems in India, we also focus on developing equitable strategies to reduce food loss and food waste and mitigate climate impacts     ?With broader systems change and food systems perspective, we work with diverse stakeholders like governments, businesses, civil society partners and farmer producer organizations to inform and develop land use strategies based on robust evidence and analysis to build the resilience of local communities to mitigate climate impacts, bridge capacity gaps, monitor progress, and inform a pathway to building a restoration economy for people, nature, and climate     ?The selected candidate will work closely with the project lead(s) and Director of the Program as well as with the organization?s core communications team to the support the program?s vision     The role provides an opportunity to co-create an impactful communications and engagement strategy for landscape restoration and leading the implementation of the same by creating engaging and informative communication products to share our research and recommendations and disseminating them across media and through events and workshops           How your day will unfold:?      - Support the development of detailed communications strategy in line with the project requirement(s) and in coordination with project team and core communications team   - Support the development of the strategic engagement plan with the relevant stakeholders in coordination with the project lead   - Lead communications across events, roundtables, workshops, and virtual events, as needed to facilitate strategic engagement, participation, awareness building and build partnerships   - Lead dissemination of research pieces, blogs, stories, infographics and other communications products through appropriate channels and/or events   - Manage the co-creation of video blogs, stories, voices from the field, infographics and other communications material planned in the strategy.   - Manage high-level convening, workshops, seminars, etc., and communications around them in coordination with the project leads and the team   - Design and edit the content that will go into the web assets and/or microsite and take part in the conceptualization of the web asset and/or microsite with the project team   - Ensure high quality communications products by supporting the team with proofreading and/or editing support for the modules prepared for the capacity building initiatives   - Track, evaluate and report on metrics of success, and adapt strategies to grow and improve outreach results over time      Additional Responsibility:     - Manage quality control and ensure timely dissemination of social media content, emailers and newsletters   - Co-author and/or review, edit and proofread blogs, articles, social media posts, and other communications material.   - Create and maintain social media strategies around events, launch of research papers, op-eds, articles, etc.   - Assist the food, land and water program with developing the content to be posted on social media handles including but not limited to Twitter, LinkedIn, Facebook, YouTube, and Instagram   - Assist the team with planning and executing in person and online events on Zoom, MS Teams, Google Meet, WebEx, etc.   - Assist the team in planning and executing pre- and post ? event social media outreach strategy      Qualifications and requirements we seek:?      Post-graduate in mass communication, data journalism, public relations or a related field with focus on environmental issues     At least 7 ? 8 years of full-time work experience working in public relations, journalism, communications     Demonstrated experience in communicating on issues related to social, environmental, food, landscape restoration and climate change related issues for diverse audience     Demonstrated experience in developing video blogs, stories from the field, infographics, newsletters, brochures, reports etc.     Experience in managing media outreach, curating media interactions with journalists and speaker/interviewee prep preferred     Working knowledge of PowerPoint, Adobe InDesign, Canva, Pardot, Salesforce, Cision, Asana and similar tools preferred     Ability to manage multiple vendors and ensure timely delivery     Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced complex office environment, both independently and as part of the team     Highly motivated, proactive work style, excellent organizational and project management skills. Keen attention to detail     Ability to lead the planning, coordination, and execution of communications products required; background in influence strategies, and audience targeting preferred

Build and develop the global project team to ensure project/product rollouts in different markets, maximum performance, providing purpose, direction, and motivation.      Lead projects from requirements definition through deployment, identifying schedules, scopes, budget estimations, and project implementation plans, including risk mitigation.      To coordinate internal and external resources, ensuring projects remain within scope, schedule, and defined budgets, in collaboration with project staff from various functional departments.      Analyze project progress and, when necessary, adapt scope, timelines, and costs to ensure that project team adheres to project requirements.
